title: 109_hr6263
content: There are no relevant paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk to assist with summarizing the curr_chunk. The Delaware and Lehigh National Heritage Corridor Act of 1988 is updated to include the historic system of the Industrial Revolution integrating anthracite mining, canals, railroads, commerce, and heavy industry. Section 4 is amended to replace "Environmental Resources" with "Conservation and Natural Resources." Section 8 is modified to include review and approval by the Secretary of the strategic plan. The Delaware and Lehigh National Heritage Corridor Act of 1988 is updated to include preserving the historic transportation system of Canals and overland railroads. The Corporation shall develop a Strategic Plan based on findings and recommendations. The Corporation shall develop a Strategic Plan based on findings and recommendations from a study conducted by the National Park Service Conservation Study Institute. The plan will guide future investment, strengthen partnerships, and prioritize actions for the Delaware and Lehigh National Heritage Corridor. Upon enactment, the Corporation will become the local management entity and implement the management action plan using Federal funds. The Corporation may use Federal funds for grants, agreements, staff, contracts, and obtaining money. Amendments include assisting the Corporation upon request and replacing "Commission" with "Corporation" in subsections. The Secretary will enter into a memorandum of understanding with the Corporation for the transition of local management and coordination on the implementation of the management action plan. Additionally, the Secretary will conduct a special resource study of sites within the Corridor to understand its national significance, focusing on anthracite mining, industries, transportation, and commerce. The special resource study will evaluate the possibility of designating sites in the greater anthracite region of Pennsylvania as units of the National Park System within 3 years of funding availability. Coordination with the Corporation and Commonwealth will be essential for this evaluation. The Corporation, Commonwealth, political subdivisions, and non-profit agencies will take actions in the preservation of significant resources in the Corridor and anthracite region. The Secretary will submit a report to the House and Senate committees after the special resource study is completed. In section 12, "Commission" will be replaced with "Corporation". In section 14, amendments include defining the term 'Corporation' as the Delaware and Lehigh National Heritage Corridor, Incorporated, a tax-exempt organization under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
